column4: Yes, as a general rule dual core is better.. most people don't need use more than a few ghz anyway. I have a 1.6 ghz dualcore and it works better for me than a 3.0 ghz single core
I wonder if I should just build another pc
I don't know... I guess it depends on your situation. Since this doesn't pertain to ubuntu or linux do you think we should take this to PM?
